text: VIENNA, June 12 Austria is temporarily reducing value-added tax for restaurants as well as cultural businesses to 5% to help them cope in the wake of the coronavirus pandemic, the government said on Friday.The move means that less tax will be owed on a range of items including cinema and museum tickets, books and newspapers, the junior minister for culture, Andrea Mayer, told a news conference with Tourism Minister Elisabeth Koestinger and Finance Minister Gernot Bluemel. (Reporting by Francois Murphy; Editing by Catherine Evans)
